results.title: O' Lucky man
results.creator_credit: Lindsay Anderson, Michael Medwin, Memorial, Sam and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Director Lindsay Anderson delivers a film that consciously plays with the telling of a story, beginning with sepia tone and the opening line ‘Once Upon a Time’. From then on we’re launched into technicolour and taken on the surreal journey of an ambitious young man in search of success who is constantly thwarted by the British Establishment. Mick Travis (Malcolm McDowell), a trainee coffee salesman, is both optimistic and naive. With his desire to be successful he eagerly jumps at any opportunity with wilful ignorance that inevitably leads him into the path of sinister digressions that challenge his good intentions. Each vignette plays on the genres of film from horror to comedy, realism to surrealism. The actors deftly play several roles each, their characters weave in and out of the story line to occasionally reconnect in this sprawling celebration of allegory.

results.title: The Eel = Unagi
results.creator_credit: Shohei Imamura, Hisa Lino, Imamura Productions, KSS Films, Satellite Cinema and Shochiku
results.brief_description: The Eel begins with the main character - Takuro Yamashita (Koji Yakusho) coming home early from a fishing trip to catch his wife committing adultery. He stabs her to death and then hands himself in to the police. The credits to the film commence, where it is revealed that Yamashita has just been released after eight years in prison. He carries with him a pet eel who has been his main companion in prison. Yamashita buys a dilapidated barber shop in a small rural town where he assumes he will be left alone. Soon, however, he is befriended by the assorted local characters who hang around his shop. Then he saves the life of Keiko Hattori (Misa Shimizu), a woman attempting to commit suicide to escape her manipulative fiance and her mad mother - and who also happens to resemble his murdered wife. The lives of these two escapees soon become entwined. Winner of the 1997 Cannes Palme d’Or, Shohei Imamura’s film masterfully balances humour and surreal imagery with a tale of redemption and love. The film bristles with the tension of Yamashita’s constant potential for violence and the surprising comical twists of his journey. In Japanese with English subtitles.

results.title: Chronicle of a love = Loving lie
results.brief_description: Antonioni’s highly acclaimed first film relates the tale of an adulterous wife and her impoverished lover who plan to murder her rich husband. He dies before they carry out the deed and they have to live with the guilt of their intentions. In Italian with English subtitles.

results.title: The Fifth element (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Luc Besson, Patrick Ledoux, Columbia and Gaumont-British Instructional
results.brief_description: The Fifth Element takes an amazing glimpse into the future, with wonderful visual effects from the people who gave us “Titanic”, “Nikita” and “The Professional”, and unique costumes by visionary designer, Jean-Paul Gaultier. If the four elements are fire, water, earth and air, what is the Fifth element? What does it do? Who has control of it? These questions and others are answered as the film unfolds at a breath taking pace. This film takes you on a sci-fi thrill ride of the decade. Bruce Willis, a taxi-driver in New York city in the 23rd Century is selected as our hero. He will travel to the end of the galaxy to decide the fate of our universe. Cast includes Gary Oldman, Milla Jovovich, Ian Holm and Chris Tucker.

results.title: The Castle (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Rob Sitch, Debra Choate and Working Dog
results.brief_description: How Darryl Kerrigan, average working joe, and his small time suburban lawyer mate, Denis Denuto ended up in the High Court of Australia is the story told in ‘The Castle’. The Kerrigan family live at 3 Highview Crescent, Cooloroo, on the edge of an international airport, in total obscurity. That is until the consortium owning the airport decide to expand and the land surrounding the airport is to be compulsorily acquired from the residents. What the powers-that-be did not count on was the dogged determination of Darryl Kerrigan, greyhound racer, tow-truck driver with a keen eye for a bargain, to whom his house is his family’ home and a very happy one at that. Ordinary family.

results.title: The Last bus home
results.creator_credit: Johnny Gogan, Paul Donovan and Bandit Films Ltd
results.brief_description: Dublin forms the backdrop of this evocative film about friendship, punk music, secrets, sexuality, and Dublin in the late 70’s and early 80’s. Punks Reena (Annie Ryan) and Jessop (Brian O’Byrne) meet on the day the Pope comes to Dublin. They form an instant alliance both physically and musically, and together with bassist Joe (Barry Comerford) and drummer Petie (John Cronin), begin 3 years of work to gain recognition for their band; The Dead Patriots. Tensions rise personally, with repercussions professionally as one feeds off the other. The situation reaches a head when Jessop discovers a secret and makes his feelings known at the band’s final farewell gig. 10 years pass and the members re-unite for a final confrontation and re-unification. Cast also includes Anthony Brophy, Brendan Coyle and Donal O’Kelly.

results.title: Lucia
results.creator_credit: Humberto Solas, Camilo Vives, Raul Canosa and Instituto Cubano del Arte e Industrias Cinematográficos (ICAIC)
results.brief_description: Acclaimed worldwide as the `Gone With the Wind of the Cuban film industry’, ‘Lucia’ is indeed Cuba’s first film spectacular, an epic, three-part feature film dramatizing three separate periods in the Cuban struggle for liberation in order to show the participation of Cuban women in that fight. In 1895, Lucia is embroiled in a tale of love and betrayal during Cuba’s war for independence from Spain; in 1933, Lucia leaves her middle-class family and becomes involved in the overthrow of the Cuban dictator Machado; and in the 1960’s, Lucia is taught how to read and write during Cuba’s literacy campaign and, as a newlywed, confronts her husband’s macho attitudes. Each episode is filmed in a distinctive visual style which translates the spirit of each historical era, with the themes of love, death and war achieving epic proportions, and providing the viewer with a good example of the role of women in history. In Spanish with English subtitles. Cast includes Raquel Revuelta, Eduardo Maure and Eslinda Nunez. (Awards: Golden Globe 1969)

results.title: Diary of a lost girl = Das Tagebuch einer verlorenen
results.brief_description: A melodrama portraying the adventures of an innocent led astray. The heroine (Louise Brooks), seduced by her pharmacist father’s lascivious assistant, bears an illegitimate child. Judged harshly by her family she is sent to a brutally run reformatory, escapes into prostitution and is finally reinstated in society. Based on a popular novel which mixed emancipatory and sentimental elements, Pabst’s film is indeterminately updated. Although presumably set in Weimar Germany there is no attempt to present an historically accurate setting. In conception the reformatory is Prussian, the brothel Victorian. Brooks’s quality of knowing innocence is at its most erotic in the brothel scenes. The film attacks the harshness of bourgeois morality without challenging patriarchy, playing upon the woman’s predicament while maintaining a male perspective. Based on the novel by Marguerite Bohme. With English intertitles.

results.title: Reality bites
results.creator_credit: Ben Stiller, Danny DeVito, Michael Shamberg and Jersey Films
results.brief_description: Reality Bites is Ben Stiller’s directorial debut, and one of the more mainstream offerings in the array of films that emphasized the “Generation X” phenomenon. Lelaina is a recent college graduate out on her own and independent from her supportive, but out-of-touch parents, facing the realities of careers and relationships in the adult world. She can’t stand her internship under a local television personality, and is forced to choose between Michael, a well-intentioned music-video network executive, and Troy, a brooding, sensitive slacker. Meanwhile, she must also protect the artistic integrity of her video documentary that depicts the everyday lives of her friends and herself. Cast includes: Winona Ryder, Ethan Hawke, Ben Stiller, Janeane Garofalo and Steve Zahn.

results.title: The Life of Oharu = Saikaku ichidai onna
results.creator_credit: Kenji Mizoguchi, Hideo Koi, Koi and Shintoho Eiga
results.brief_description: ‘The Life of Oharu’ is an adaptation of Saikaku’s classic novel which traces the tragic riches to rags life of a Japanese woman in 17th century Japan. Told in the form of flashback, the film begins with an elderly Oharu praying before Buddha, reflecting on her life, and her first love. Years ago the well respected Oharu fell in love with a samurai (played by a young Toshiro Mifune), only to lose favour with her family who are exiled for her actions, as well as her love who is promptly beheaded. Her father forces her to become mistress of a great lord in order to bear him an heir, which she does, but is abandoned by the prince after she gives birth. Outcast by the prince, Oharu slides to the lowest rank in society and is forced into becoming a prostitute and beggar. Her life is populated by love and servitude to the men she encounters, as well as the knowledge that her royal son is the one chance she has at escaping her life of poverty and humiliation. The sufferings of the beautiful Oharu (Kinuyo Tanaka) are observed without sentimentality or moralising by Mizoguchi who is acknowledged as being a lifelong advocate of equitable treatment for Japanese women. In Japanese with English subtitles. Cast also includes Ichiro Sugai, Toshiro Yanane and Ataro Shindo.

Her life is populated by love and servitude to the men she encounters, as well as the knowledge that her royal son is the one chance she has at escaping her life of poverty and humiliation. The sufferings of the beautiful Oharu (Kinuyo Tanaka) are observed without sentimentality or moralising by Mizoguchi who is acknowledged as being a lifelong advocate of equitable treatment for Japanese women. In Japanese with English subtitles. Cast also includes Ichiro Sugai, Toshiro Yanane and Ataro Shindo.
